LEGAL_NOTICE.CONTENT_RESPONSIBLE: Responsible for content according to § 55 Abs. 2 RStV
LEGAL_NOTICE.DISCLAIMER_TEXT: The contents of these pages were created with the greatest care. However, we cannot guarantee that the content is correct, complete or up-to-date. As a service provider, we are responsible for our own content on these pages in accordance with general laws in accordance with Section 7 Paragraph 1 TMG. However, according to Sections 8 to 10 TMG, as a service provider we are not obliged to monitor transmitted or stored third-party information or to investigate circumstances that indicate illegal activity.
LEGAL_NOTICE.LINK_TEXT: This website contains links to external third-party websites over whose content we have no influence. We therefore cannot assume any liability for this external content. The respective provider or operator of the pages is always responsible for the content of the linked pages. The linked pages were checked for possible legal violations at the time of linking. Illegal content was not apparent at the time of linking.
LEGAL_NOTICE.COPYRIGHT_TEXT: The content and works on these pages created by the site operator are subject to German copyright law.

WORK_TOGETHER.ABOUT_ME: I enjoy creating user-friendly frontend solutions. I quickly learn new frameworks and apply them effectively in my projects. Whether in a team or remote, I always work efficiently. With creative ideas and solution-oriented thinking, I develop interfaces that are both functional and visually appealing.

MY_WORK.DESCRIPTION: Discover a selection of my work – interact with projects to see my skills in action.

JOIN.DESCRIPTION: Task manager inspired by the Kanban system. Create and organize tasks using drag-and-drop and assign users and categories.

POLLO.DESCRIPTION: Jump’n’Run game with throwing mechanics. Help Pepe collect coins and Tabasco to fight the crazy chicken.

POKEDEX.DESCRIPTION: Based on the PokéAPI – a simple library to display and catalog Pokémon data.

REF_SECTION.COLLEAGUES: This is what my colleagues say about our collaboration:

CATALINA.COMMIT: Jenny and I worked together on the Kochwelt project. I was positively impressed by her independent work style as well as her friendly and helpful nature. She brought strong frontend skills to the table and was always eager to learn new things. I would gladly work with Jenny again anytime.

CARYEN.COMMIT: Jenny carried out all tasks entrusted to her with great reliability and care. Her strong determination, deep interest, and remarkable diligence stood out. Working with her was extremely pleasant and enriching. I am confident that she will be a valuable asset in any future project as well.

PATRICK.COMMIT: Jennifer was very independent and always focused – while bringing just the right touch of humor. The atmosphere within the team was relaxed and warm, which made working together truly enjoyable.

STEPHIE.COMMIT: Jenny brought an incredible amount of joy and positive energy to the project. She was always reliable and enriched the team with her open and approachable nature. What impressed me most was how often she helped us move forward with fresh, unconventional ideas whenever we were stuck on a challenge. Her support was consistently dependable and motivating. Working with Jenny was truly a pleasure – thank you!

JON.COMMIT: Jennifer Thomas was a great asset to our final project at the Developer Akademie. She quickly found her footing, demonstrated strong technical skills, asked insightful questions, and maintained a clear overview even in challenging situations. Her positive attitude, sense of humor, and clear communication made her a highly valued team member. A wholehearted recommendation – both professionally and personally.

CONTACT.TITLE: Contact
CONTACT.SUBTITLE: Got a problem to solve?
CONTACT.DESCRIPTION: I am fluent in HTML, CSS and JavaScript. I always keep accessibility in mind so that everyone can be reached. When UI design meets usability, intuitive experiences emerge. Let's start together!
CONTACT.PRIVACY_AND: and agree to the processing of my data as outlined.
